main event: A radar observation detected a round green object southeast of Farmington, New Mexico on September 25, 1960.
interesting points: The object was tracked on radar before being visually sighted,The object was described as a round ball of fire with a size of approximately 2,000 yards,The object changed course nearly instantly to the northwest after being sighted,The observation lasted approximately 5-10 minutes, No photographs were included with the report.
witness description: Radar operator who tracked and sighted the object.
